column1: umbar is a noun meaning "fate" in Quenya.
Image:Umbar.gifUmbar is also the name in Quenya of the sixth letter of the Tengwar alphabet. It is the second letter of the second grade or Tyellë
column2: which contains "voiced stops" and it is the second letter in the labial or p-series of consonants
column3: the Parmatéma. In the standard spelling of Quenya Umbar represents MB.
column4: Note In all other modes this letter represents B. The Westron name for this letter is Bí.See Westron Tengwar

column1: The word ambar ("doom") may be a variant. The word derives from the Primitive Quendian Sundocarmë MBARAT
column2: MBARAT- It is also possible that umbar contains the prefix u- (u + ambar)
column3: meaning that it has mainly negative and dark connotations compared to plain ambar

column1: * http://www.uib.no/People/hnohf/qlist.htm Quenya Corpus Wordlist edited by Helge Fauskanger
